title: Grub2 hangs when booted from EFI shell

forumNotes.author: shareknw
forumNotes.content:
I would appreciate if someone would help me out to resolve this issue.  

From the EFI shell, I am invoking Grub.efi which is stored on a USBdrive which acts as Fat32 EFI system partition. On the USB, I have stored all the grub modules, grub.efi,grub.cfg and also the kernel image to load. When I execute grub.efi, I get the grub menu on screen. When I select a menu entry, it gets hung.  
The below is the commands which i execute from the shell.  
fs0:x86_64-boot\\x86_64-grub\\grub.efi  

when I add debug=all in the menu entry, at the end of logs, i get the following:  
**GOP success and it hangs**   

I tried adding set gfxpayload=640x480 in menu entry but the behaviour remains the same.
